oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Flag given for War Mothers and Widows tour
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: In the early 1930s, the US government paid the expenses of "Gold Star Widows and Mothers" to visit the American WWI cemeteries in France. This 48 star American flag was probably given to Sarah Frances M. Ring during her trip to France in 1933. Her son, Frank M. Ring, was killed in October, 1918 while serving in Co. A, 114th MG Battn., 30th Div. The Ring family were longtime residents of Williamson County. The family sent three brothers to World War I. Frank was the only one killed.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
